title: Who was the president when the Clean Air Act was passed? - Quora
tags: Presidents of the United States of America

response.answer_text: The act was a Democratic initiative in the House and was passed by both houses in 1963 during the Kennedy administration and was signed into law that year by Lyndon Johnson and became effective the same year.

Here’s the crazy thing, especially these days, but it was none other than Tricky Dick Nixon. Yeah, the president who resigned from the office in a swirl of controversy being caught directing members of the RNC to break into the offices of the DNC to get dirt on the upcoming election. He also passed the Clean Water Act, and signed Earth Day into being.
